Package main.java.org.skloch.game

Class GameScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.org.skloch.game.GameScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
    public class GameScreen
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
    Handles the majority of the game logic, rendering and user inputs of the game. Responsible for rendering the player and the map, and calling events.

      • GameOver

        public void GameOver()
        Ends the game, called at the end of the 7th day, switches to a game over screen that displays score, streaks and more. Calculates the final stats of the activities performed over the week, then invokes the calculateScore and calculateStreaks methods to pass these into the game over screen.

      • calculateScore

        public static int calculateScore​(int daysStudied,
                                 int totalTimesStudied,
                                 int totalHoursStudied,
                                 int totalHoursRecreation,
                                 int daysEatenBreakfast,
                                 int daysEatenLunch,
                                 int daysEatenDinner,
                                 java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> streaks)
        Calculates a final score based upon the stats of the final game, given as parameters. If a player hasn't studied enough, they get a final score of 0. Otherwise, score is added based upon how much they studied (score is deducted if they are overworked), how many recreational hours they had, if they ate at regular intervals, etc. This is added upon a baseline score of 500. The higher the score, the better they did on their exam.
        Parameters:
        daysStudied - - How many days the player studied throughout the week.
        totalTimesStudied - - How many times the player studied throughout the week.
        totalHoursStudied - - How many hours the player studied throughout the week.
        totalHoursRecreation - - How many recreational hours the player did throughout the week.
        daysEatenBreakfast - - How many days the player ate breakfast.
        daysEatenLunch - - How many days the player ate lunch.
        daysEatenDinner - - How many days the player ate dinner.
        streaks - - The streaks that the player achieved.
        Returns:
        final score as an integer

      • calculateStreaks

        public static java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> calculateStreaks​(int totalPiazzaEvents,
                                                                   int totalPubEvents,
                                                                   int totalTownEvents,
                                                                   int totalLibraryEvents)
        Calculates what streaks were achieved, if any, given the amount of times certain places were visited, given as parameters. If they were visited enough times in the week, a streak is achieved.
        Parameters:
        totalPiazzaEvents - - Number of times the piazza was visited throughout the week.
        totalPubEvents - - Number of times the pub was visited throughout the week.
        totalTownEvents - - Number of times town was visited throughout the week.
        totalLibraryEvents - - Number of times the library was visited throughout the week.
        Returns:
        streaks that were achieved, given as a set of strings.
